name: 2nd Global Conference on Waste Management and Recycling
content: The 2nd Global Conference on Waste Management and Recycling, scheduled for 24-26 October 2024 in Nice, France, is a premier international event that brings together experts and professionals from around the globe to discuss the latest advancements, challenges, and solutions in waste management and recycling. This conference will feature a series of keynote speeches, panel discussions, and workshops covering a wide array of topics such as circular economy, zero waste strategies, waste-to-energy technologies, and sustainable waste management practices. Attendees will have the opportunity to network with peers, exchange knowledge and experience, and explore innovative solutions to some of the most pressing environmental issues of our time. Whether you are a professional, researcher, or policymaker, this conference offers an excellent opportunity to stay up-to-date with the latest trends and developments in the field. Important Dates: Paper Submission Deadline: 10 October 2024 Early Registration Deadline: 31 July 2024 Final Registration Deadline: 17 October 2024 Additionally, attendees will enjoy a complimentary one-day city tour, providing a perfect blend of professional and cultural enrichment. The previous round of the conference was held from 15-17 March 2024 in Berlin, Germany. For those delegates who need a visa, we strongly recommend securing an official Letter of Invitation from the WMRCONF organizers, as it can significantly facilitate the visa application process. Please be aware that Letters of Invitation will be issued exclusively to delegates who have completed their registration and made the necessary payments or received approval. Join us for the best recycling conference of the year and enjoy numerous benefits, including networking opportunities, learning about the latest trends and innovations in the field, access to industry leaders and policymakers, and exposure to the latest technologies and products in waste management and recycling.
